Letter from the Principal

Dear Parents,

We believe that every child is a precious gift from God of immeasurable worth and significance. We treasure the young women who spend each and every day at Mercy McAuley High School. We welcome the young women who are deciding to become a member of the Class of 2023. Each and every one of your daughters are unique with very special gifts.

A wolf is known to take calculated risks, and at Mercy McAuley, we believe in calculated risks. "Progress always involves risks. You can't steal second base and keep your foot on first." — Frederick Wilcox

Next week is Catholic Schools Week. We celebrate the importance of our Catholic Faith and traditions. The themes for each day are as follows:

Monday – Mercy McAuley

Tuesday – Community Appreciation

Wednesday – Family Appreciation

Thursday – Employee Appreciation

Friday – Student Appreciation

Last week, several Mercy McAuley students attended the Life March in Washington, D.C. What a great opportunity to show our support for the unborn and to take part peacefully in showing our support for the beliefs of our faith. Thank you to everyone that made the trip happen, and a big thank to our students who attended.

"The right to life is the first among human rights." – Pope Francis

We thank you for sharing your daughters with us, each and every day. They are a blessing to us.

Mercy and compassion always in our hearts,

Connie Kampschmidt

Principal

Save the Date for "State of the School Address"

On Monday, Jan. 28, Mercy McAuley President Patty Ragio will present our first annual "State of the School Address" at Mercy McAuley. All Mercy McAuley parents, students, Mercy and McAuley alumnae, and members of the community are invited to attend. Mrs. Ragio will provide an overview of facts and memorable happenings from Mercy McAuley's first year thus far. The presentation will take place from 7:30 - 8 p.m. Following the presentation, light refreshments will be provided during a social time from 8 - 8:30 p.m. Please RSVP HERE if you plan to attend the State of the School Address so that we can plan for space and refreshments. We look forward to seeing you!

Athletic News

There are some big upcoming events for Winter sports!

Basketball - Grade School Night is this Thursday vs Seton! Come on out to show your school spirit and bring all those future Wolves! Games are at 4:30, 6, and 7:30.

Bowling - Two big GGCL events are coming up - Bowling vs Seton on Friday at 4 p.m. at Western Bowl. This match has GGCL title implications, and the Wolves could use a ton of support! Also, the GGCL tournament is Monday, January 28 at 4 p.m. at Colerain Bowl!

Swimming and Diving - Senior Night is Friday! There will be an intersquad meet beginning at 7 p.m. at Powell Crosley, with senior introductions to take place about 7:25. Come on out to support the Wolves! Also, the GGCL Diving meet is this weekend, and the GGCL Swim meet is Wednesday, January 30 at St. Xavier. These are all great events to support our Wolves!

NLI Signing Day - We will host a NLI Signing Day on Wednesday, February 6. This will occur at 7:30 a.m. in the library. We have several athletes who have decided to play at the next level. Parents need to email Athletic Director Denise Harvey at harveyd@mercymcauley.org to register to participate in the event. Please include your daughter's name, sport, and college chosen. We will email further details to those that register.

Service Update

Volunteers Needed for Sophomore Day of Service - The Campus Ministers and Service Coordinator have been meeting with the sophomore class on a regular basis to prepare them for their Sophomore Service Retreat. This day of service takes place on Friday, March 29, when the entire sophomore class will engage in service with various local non-profits. We are in need of some parent chaperones to assist us, who are Virtus trained and compliant. If you are interested in volunteering on March 29 from approximately 8 a.m. – 2:30 p.m., please email Kelly Starkey at starkeyk@mercymcauley.org. Thank you in advance for your time and generosity.

St. Vincent de Paul Collection - Our service theme for January is "Providing Peace to those in Poverty." During Catholic Schools Week, we will collect non-perishables and personal care items to benefit the clients of St. Vincent de Paul. Your daughters can bring in these items any day next week and place them in their dens. Click HERE for a flyer with more specifics on what items are most needed, however, all items are welcome.
